newsitem.title: MEXICO: Tribasa sees revenues of $700 mln in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Tribasa sees revenues of $700 mln in 1997.

text.p: Construction firm Grupo Tribasa expects revenues in 1997 to reach $700 million, more than double the level in 1996, a top company official said on Tuesday.
In 1996, its sales were $299.3 million, up 2.7 percent from 1995.

"I reckon we will end up in Chile and other international projects with around $400 million in revenues, and in Mexico with about $300 million," Finance Director Andres Caire said on a conference call.
He said the firm aimed to alter its mix of foreign and Mexican contracts from 60/40 to 50/50.
Tribasa's backlog, or contracts to be completed, at the end of the year would be worth around $1.5 billion, up from $1.257 billion in 1996, he said.
